sentences.en: A similar sort of stalemate existed at sea.
sentences.cn: 在海上,存在着同样的僵持局面.

sentences.en: an attempt to break the stalemate
Efforts to break the stalemate in the peace talks continue.
sentences.cn: 打破和平谈判僵局的努力仍在继续.

sentences.en: Even if the battle ends only in a stalemate, they may feel far more free.
sentences.cn: 即使战争结果陷于相持不下的僵局, 它们也许会感到远比以前更加自由.

sentences.en: He said the war had reached a stalemate and that a political accord was the only solution.
sentences.cn: 他说战争已陷入僵局，政治协议是唯一的解决办法。

sentences.en: His tricks will bring us into a stalemate.
sentences.cn: 他的花招会使我们陷入僵局.

sentences.en: Otherwise the prospect is for stalemate.
sentences.cn: 不然的话,前景只能是僵局.

sentences.en: So sometimes the negotiations impasse, is in a stalemate on the issue.
sentences.cn: 有时谈判所以出现僵局, 是僵持在某个问题上.

sentences.en: The discussions with the miners’ union ended in stalemate .
sentences.cn: 同矿工工会的谈判以陷入僵局而告终。

sentences.en: The fight resulted in a stalemate.
The Russian front is at a stalemate.
The stalemate in the trade talks continues.
sentences.cn: 贸易谈判的僵持仍在继续.

sentences.en: The war was at a stalemate.
They clawed their way back, but only to stalemate.
sentences.cn: 等他们慢吞吞的回过头来时, 却只发现那是条死胡同.

sentences.en: This stalemate situation made a decisive victory seem impossible to the Japanese.
sentences.cn: 这种情况使日军决定性的征服中国变得几乎不可能.

sentences.en: Two alternative systems are useful to avoid this stalemate.
sentences.cn: 此时采用下列两种系统之一便可加以解决.

words.tran_cn: 拖延；使停转；使陷于泥中

trans.tran_en: a situation in which it seems impossible to settle an argument or disagreement, and neither side can get an advantage
